stanza.line: Being your slave what should I do but tendtend
Upon the hours and times of your desiredesire
I have no precious time at all to spendspend
Nor services to do till you requirerequire
Nor dare I chide the world-without-end hourhour
Whilst I (my sovereign) watch the clock for youyou
Nor think the bitterness of absence soursour
When you have bid your servant once adieuadieu
Nor dare I question with my jealous thoughtthought
Where you may be or your affairs supposesuppose
But like a sad slave stay and think of noughtnought
Save where you are how happy you make thosethose
So true a fool is love that in your willwill
(Though you do any thing) he thinks no illill
